Pre-Installation

Download

  1. Download debian ISO:
    • Debian netinstall ISO ⇒ debian-<VERSION>-amd64-netinst.iso
    • Debian netinstall ISO with 3rd party firmware ⇒ firmware-<VERSION>-amd64-netinst.iso

Verify Download

  1. Download SHA512SUMS checksum and SHA512SUMS.sign checksum PGP signature from same location as ISO.
  2. Verify authenticity of checksum PGP signature: 

    $ gpg --verify SHA512SUMS.sign SHA512SUMS

    • If there was an error with missing public key, verify that the missing key is matching one of Debian ISO verifying keys, import it and try again: 

      $ gpg --keyserver keyring.debian.org --recv <KEY>
$ gpg --verify SHA512SUMS.sign SHA512SUMS

  3. Verify integrity of ISO file (ISO and checksum must be in the same directory): 

    $ sha512sum --ignore-missing -c SHA512SUMS

Flash USB

  1. Make sure the USB filesystem is not mounted!
  2. Flash USB with disk image: 

    # dd if=<DEBIAN>.iso of=</dev/sdX> bs=4M ; sync

USB Boot

  1. Reboot the system and during the POST phase press BIOS key1) to boot into UEFI.
  2. Make sure that Secure Boot is disabled and reboot.
  3. On next POST phase, press Boot Menu key2) and select (UEFI) USB entry.
1) , 2)
List of POST keys according to vendor: https://www.disk-image.com/faq-bootmenu.htm.
